meanings.sent1: The prorogued meeting left everyone confused about the next steps.
meanings.sent2: The prorogued event was rescheduled for next week.
meanings.sent3: The prorogued party left the guests wondering if it was over or just taking a break.
meanings.sent4: The prorogued project seemed to hang in limbo, neither completed nor abandoned.
meanings.sent5: The prorogued decision lingered in the air, unresolved and unsettling.

meanings.definition: To discontinue a session of a legislative body
meanings.sent1: The speaker prorogued the parliament after a long debate.
meanings.sent2: The Prime Minister prorogued the assembly to avoid further discussions.
meanings.sent3: The opposition members joked that the speaker prorogued the session to escape tough questions.
meanings.sent4: The decision to prorogue the meeting was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent5: The president's decision to prorogue the congress surprised many lawmakers.

meanings.sent1: The company prorogued the product launch due to technical issues.
meanings.sent2: The team leader prorogued the meeting until everyone was present.
meanings.sent3: The student prorogued studying for the exam until the last minute.
meanings.sent4: The manager prorogued the deadline to give the team more time.
meanings.sent5: The professor prorogued the assignment submission to accommodate the students' requests.
